overview.title: Overview
overview.content: Sindhudurg Fort, located on the scenic Malvan coast, is one of Maharashtra’s most iconic sea forts. Built by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in the 17th century, the fort stands proudly on an island surrounded by the Arabian Sea. It was designed to safeguard the Maratha Empire’s western coastline from foreign invaders.

highlights.title: Highlights
points: Built under the direct supervision of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in 1664 CE
Covers an area of 48 acres with strong laterite stone walls
Contains the only temple dedicated to Shivaji Maharaj
Panoramic views of the Malvan coastline and the Arabian Sea
Still accessible only by boats during high tide

architecture.title: Architecture
architecture.content: Sindhudurg Fort is an architectural marvel of its time, built using laterite stones on a rocky island. The walls are 9 meters high and 3 meters thick, designed to withstand fierce sea waves and enemy attacks.
features: Massive laterite stone walls rising directly from the sea
Secret escape routes and hidden entrances
Residences, wells, and temples within the fort
Famous hand and foot impressions of Shivaji Maharaj

history.title: History
history.content: Sindhudurg Fort was built by Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj between 1664 and 1667 to fortify the western coast against Portuguese and British powers. Over 100 Portuguese masons and local workers contributed to the fort’s construction, using an ingenious blend of lime and jaggery to bind the stones.
events: Construction began in 1664 CE under Shivaji Maharaj’s supervision
Fort served as the naval base for the Maratha Navy
Contains the rare temple dedicated to Shivaji Maharaj himself
Witnessed battles against British and Portuguese fleets

attractions.title: Attractions
places: Shivaji Maharaj Temple inside the fort
Hand and footprint impressions of Chhatrapati Shivaji
Ancient freshwater well within the fort premises

activities.title: Activities
options: Take a boat ride to reach the fort from Malvan jetty
Explore the fort’s bastions, temples, and hidden tunnels
Visit the Shivaji Maharaj temple and historical points
Enjoy snorkeling and scuba diving in nearby Tarkarli waters

modes.byRoad: Malvan is around 530 km from Mumbai and 145 km from Ratnagiri. Regular state transport and private buses are available.
modes.byTrain: The nearest railway station is Kudal (about 30 km). From there, local transport is available to Malvan jetty.
modes.byAir: The nearest airport is Chipi Airport (Sindhudurg Airport), about 12 km from Malvan.

bestTimeToVisit.title: Best Time to Visit
bestTimeToVisit.content: The best time to visit Sindhudurg Fort is between October and March when the sea is calm and boat rides are operational.

tips.title: Travel Tips
points: Boat services to the fort depend on weather conditions; check in advance.
Wear comfortable footwear and carry water for the short trek around the fort.
Avoid visiting during monsoon season (June to September) due to rough seas.
